alert.note: Alert for Eastern Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 2:55PM EST until December 24 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO 10 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected; wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain; additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...In Virginia, Eastern Highland County, and Central Virginia Blue Ridge. In West Virginia, Eastern Pendleton County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM Friday to 10 AM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact holiday travel. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Wind Chill Warning, the highest wind speeds will be Friday into Friday evening. Affects from the extreme cold could be made worse due to power outages.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling.
